Important Articles.headline: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) saw a 21% increase in its share price over the last quarter, supported by several strategic partnerships and expansions. The recent collaboration with Coco Robotics, launching in Miami, and the joint initiative with WeRide to enhance autonomous vehicle access in Dubai suggests UBER's commitment to innovation and market expansion. These developments were likely favorably viewed by investors amid a generally positive tech stock environment, as reflected by gains in...
Important Articles.title: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) Unveils Robot Delivery Expansion And Autonomous Ventures In Dubai

Important Articles.headline: Uber Technologies (NYSE: UBER) has navigated the recent stock market volatility well, delivering a solid 23% year-to-date gain for shareholders, while the S&P 500 index is down about 3.5% in 2025 thus far.  As the company targets new growth opportunities, a compelling case emerges that Uber's outlook is stronger than ever.  Here are four reasons I believe Uber Technologies stock can make an excellent addition to your portfolio right now.
Important Articles.title: 4 Reasons to Buy Uber Technologies Stock Like There's No Tomorrow

Important Articles.headline: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) recently announced a partnership with Petco, expanding Uber Eats to include more than 15,000 pet care products, and offering promotions for both new and existing users. Such expansion into retail aligns with Uber's strategy to diversify its offerings, also marked by similar collaborations with Sally Beauty and FreshDirect. Despite broader market pressures due to inflation concerns, the company's agile responses likely supported its stock price increase of 22%...
Important Articles.title: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) Partners With Petco For Seamless Pet Supplies Delivery

Important Articles.headline: BofA notes that President Trump’s newly announced tariffs were larger than anticipated and are “a direct negative” for discretionary retail sales and advertising. In addition, the potential for increasing recession fears fueled by the tariffs are “a relative negative for the entire Internet sector,” which the analyst notes underperformed in 2008 and 2022 as fears of a recession grew. The “only potential silver lining” is that proposed rates could be viewed as a negotiation tool that may not be f
Important Articles.title: Tariff-fueled recession fears ‘relative negative’ for Internet sector, says BofA

Important Articles.headline: Signs of Tesla's (NASDAQ: TSLA) brand crisis are almost everywhere you look.  Over the weekend, more than 200 "Tesla Takedown" protests were held across the country as Americans expressed their ire about CEO Elon Musk's project to downsize federal agencies -- which President Donald Trump refers to as the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) -- by targeting his company.  Sales in Europe appear to be plunging; registration data showed Tesla sales were down 42% across most of Europe in the first two months of the year.
Important Articles.title: Will Tesla's Pain Be This EV Stock's Gain?

Important Articles.headline: Wall Street is wasting no time adjusting their views on certain stocks in the wake of bruising Trump tariffs.
Important Articles.title: Wall Street now hates these 10 stocks because of Trump tariffs
